question: Which example shows a home being heated using energy produced from a renewable resource?

content.source_1: Sunlight is a renewable energy resource because it is continuously replenished by the Sun.
content.source_2: Concentrated solar power (CSP) plants generate electricity by using mirrors to concentrate sunlight and produce steam that spins turbines.
content.source_3: Natural gas is a nonrenewable fossil fuel.
content.source_4: Many CSP plants are hybridized with natural gas: auxiliary gas-fired systems are used during startup or low-sun periods to provide heat/steam so the plant can generate electricity when sunlight is insufficient.
content.source_5: Electricity produced from sunlight is generated using a renewable energy source.
content.source_6: When a power plant burns natural gas to generate electricity, the electricity produced at that time is generated using a nonrenewable energy source.

answer: heating a home with energy collected by solar panels
